definitions.definition: the part of a place or thing that is furthest away from the centre:
examples: This cable should have a plug at one end and a socket at the other.

definitions.definition: the final part of something such as a period of time, activity, or story:
examples: I always like to leave my desk clear at the end of the day.
We were all by her bedside when the end finally came.

definitions.definition: either of the two halves of the field in some sports:
examples: The teams change ends at half-time so that neither side has an unfair advantage.

definitions.definition: one of the two players in American football who begin play furthest from the ball

examples: Having agreed upon the matter of payment, he brought the interview to an end.

definitions.definition: finally, after something has been thought about or discussed a lot:
examples: We were thinking about going to Switzerland, but in the end we went to Austria.

definitions.definition: for hours, days, etc. without stopping:
examples: He used to lock himself in his bedroom for hours on end and refuse to talk to anyone.
Everyone wishes the war would come to an end soon.

definitions.definition: to finish or stop, or to make something finish or stop:
examples: When is your meeting due to end?
